第十三週 Week Thirteen

我沒有自由：我將覺醒作為我的自由。
——戰士信條

I have no freedom: I make awareness my freedom.
——Warrior's Creed

星期二 Tuesday
第十三週 Week Thirteen

一個年輕的僧侶問他的師傅：
「我要如何才能達到自由？」
師傅回答：「誰曾經囚禁過你？」
——Advaita teaching

A young monk asked the Master:
"How can I ever achieve freedom?"
The Master replied:
"Who ever put you in bondage?"
——Advaita teachings

第十三週 Week Thirteen

我沒有力量：我將自然的韻律作為我的力量。
——戰士信條

I have no power: I make the rhythms of nature my power.
——Warrior's Creed

星期四 Thursday
第十三週 Week Thirteen

人之生也柔弱，其死也堅強；
萬物草木之生也柔脆，其死也枯槁。
故曰：「堅強者，死之徒也！柔弱微細，生之徒也！」
兵強則不勝；木強則折。強大，居下；柔弱，居上。

——老子，道德經 76 章

A man is born gentle and weak.
At his death he is hard and stiff.
Green plants are tender and filled with sap.
At their death they are withered and dry.

Therefore the stiff and unbending is the disciple of death.
The gentle and yielding is the disciple of life.

Thus an army without flexibility never wins a battle.
A tree that is unbending is easily broken.

The hard and strong will fall.
The soft and weak will overcome.

——Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching, Chapter
76

星期五 Friday
第十三週 Week Thirteen

我沒有威信，我將誠實作為我的威信。
——戰士信條

I have no authority: I make honesty my authority.
——Warrior's Creed

星期六 Saturday
第十三週 Week Thirteen

名與身孰親？
身與貨孰多？
得與亡孰病？
甚愛必大費；多藏必厚亡。
故，知足不辱；知止不殆，可以長久。
——老子．道德經 44 章

Fame or self: Which matters more?
Self or wealth: Which is more precious?
Gain or loss: Which is more painful?

He who is attached to things will suffer much.
He who saves will suffer heavy loss.
A contented man is never disappointed.
He who knows when to stop does not find himself in trouble.
He will stay forever safe.

——Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching, Chapter 44

I have no enemies: I make indifference and carelessness my enemies.
